thig11.1:1.2: though we were mother and daughter.
thig11.1:1.3: I was struck with a sense of urgency,
thig11.1:2.3: where we, both mother and daughter,
thig11.1:3.1: Seeing the danger in sensual pleasures,
thig11.1:3.4: from the lay life to homelessness.
thig11.1:4.3: I comprehend the minds of others;
thig11.1:5.2: and attained the ending of defilements.
thig11.1:5.3: I’ve realized the six kinds of direct knowledge,
thig11.1:6.3: Then I bowed at the feet of the Buddha,
thig11.1:6.4: the glorious protector of the world.”
thig11.1:7.1: “You’ve come to this sal tree all crowned with flowers,
thig11.1:7.2: and stand at its root all alone.
thig11.1:7.3: But you have no companion with you,
thig11.1:7.4: silly girl, aren’t you afraid of rascals?”
thig11.1:8.3: I’d stir not a hair nor tremble.
thig11.1:8.4: What could you do to me all alone, Māra?
thig11.1:9.3: I could stand between your eyebrows
thig11.1:9.4: and you still wouldn’t see me.
thig11.1:10.1: I’m the master of my own mind,
thig11.1:10.2: I’ve developed the bases of psychic power well.
thig11.1:10.3: I’ve realized the six kinds of direct knowledge,
thig11.1:11.1: Sensual pleasures are like swords and stakes;
thig11.1:11.2: the aggregates are their chopping block.
thig11.1:11.4: is now no delight for me.
thig11.1:12.1: Relishing is destroyed in every respect,
thig11.1:12.2: and the mass of darkness is shattered.
thig11.1:14.1: The Book of the Twelves is finished.
